item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Waste pile / fly tipping, 12th December
item.description:
Someone else living at 98 Wickham Lane , SE2 0XW ( I think it is an HMO property) has disposed of their waste just at their front yard , making it a fire hazard as well as a shelter for rodents like rats , which is a health and safety concern . I can see rats this waste mound . Also I have seen a few times that the passing strangers scavenge for reusable stuff or something, rummaging the waste here and there . This waste pile has been here for more than two months , I thought someone else would clean it up , but I don’t think it’s gonna happen .

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement "repaired", 12th December
item.description:
Yesterday 1 man was workaholic a day-removed old broken slabs and put this base and prepared for tarmac to go over and told me will be tarmac done later on. When he left was all borded up and made safe-he done good job. Later on during the day- other people turned up, removed all boarding and they put a tiny line of tarmac at each end- left is all with tge ballast and said- job is done now and took tge protective bariers and open the pavementfor use as its complete...is this a joke...when will be tarmac put over and completed as the rest of the pavement and as supposed to be done...the little tarmac they put at each end is already coming off( 12 h later) and is a bigger trip hazard ( especially at dark hours) than was before with the lifted and broken slabs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Sydney Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council cleared leaves and haven’t cleared away, 12th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Gairloch Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a hole and wheels of prams and wheelchairs get caught here, 12th December
item.description:
It’s as though the pavement is lower than the road. This has been like this for years but this week I witnessed man in an electric wheelchair get his wheels caught and his wheelchair flipped forward. He smashed his face on the road and was laying there with his wheelchair on his back. He needed hospital treatment.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Empress Drive, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
